intro: Rochea subulata, commonly known as the needleleaf rochea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Rochea subulata thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
